title.narrative: Governance and Public Administration Reform Programme Phase II: 2012-15

description.narrative: The overall purpose of the Good Governance and Public Administration Programme (GOPA II) is to strengthen the effect of administrative and democratic reforms in Vietnam. The objectives of the three components are: i) to strengthen the capacity of five provinces to implement public administrative reform process to reduce bureaucracy and improve the quality of public services with a focus on ensuring popular participation in planning, implementation and monitoring the reform processes, on assistance to poverty reduction and gender equality as well as on implementing initiatives that may support good practices of public administration; ii) to promote human rights by consolidating and strengthening the capacity and the cooperation among universities and institutions within education and research in human rights; and iii) to strengthen good governance by strengthening the capacity of members of parliament and by promoting popular participation in policy-making and legislative processes. The support to parliament involves a direct cooperation between the National Assembly and the Danish Folketing. The support to popular participation in policy-making and legislative processes involves the establishment of a grant-making facility targeting civil society organisations (PARAFF). Support to PARAFF is co-funded with the United Kingdom that initially committed at 13 million kr but subsequently reduced to less than 8 million kr
